title: Anna Fischer-Dückelmann
summary: Anna Fischer-Dückelmann (1856–1917). She was one of the first women to receive a medical degree in the German-speaking countries, received from the University of Zurich. In 1896 she earned a degree at the University and at this time women were still not allowed to be enrolled in German universities or medical schools. She has since been known as a naturopath and physician for women in Germany. She has published many books and they have been converted into many different languages.
